str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To wage war, fight, serve as a soldier; fig: of the warring lusts against the soul.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To blackmail, extort from, intimidate. From dia and seio; to shake thoroughly, i.e. to intimidate.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From a compound of sukon and a derivative of phaino; to be a fig-informer, 'sycophant', i.e. to defraud.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To keep off, assist; I suffice; pass: To be satisfied. Apparently a primary verb; properly, to ward off, i.e. to avail.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the same as opsarion; rations for a soldier, i.e. his stipend or pay.
